fields.Title of Contribution: A Configurational Theory of Power and Trust in Conference Buyer-Supplier Relationships
fields.Name of Conference: 36th Annual Meeting of the Decision Sciences Institute
fields.Description/Abstract: In this conceptual piece, we review the strengths and weaknesses of portfolio models in the field of purchasing. We argue that 2x2 portfolio models hinder researchers’ and practitioners’ ability to improve sourcing strategy formulation. We propose that using a configurational theory can help removing most of the weaknesses commonly attributed to portfolio models. Consequently, we introduce a typology of ideal sourcing strategies and propose that a congruent alignment around one of these ideal types can improve purchasing performance. The dimensions considered in the description of ideal types include product and market characteristics as well as the coordination mechanisms used in the relationship, including power and trust.
